value.title: How to refresh web sources in Power BI service
value.excerpt: If you have connected to a web source in power bi desktop and they try to connect to the service, you have probably gotten this error:  "You can't schedule refresh for this dataset because the following data sources currently don't support refresh: Data source for Query1"  In today's video I am going

value.title: Import images in Power BI from local sources
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you how to import images in Power BI with the help of SQL Jason.  He shows in his blog post how you can import images in Power BI from your local folder for offline use. Read more about it here: http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  and

value.title: Insert text anywhere in a cell without adding a new column using the Power Query User Interface.
value.excerpt: There are no Insert functions ( that I know about) in the power query user interface, so if you dont know M, you probably have to create a new column to insert text in power query.  In today's video, I will show you how you can use power query user interface, to insert text into a column without adding

value.title: Is MANY TO MANY, too many? | Power BI many to many relationships explained

value.title: Making (some) things transparent in Power BI

Enjoy"  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power and Excel BI! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ7UhloHSA4wAqPzyi6TOkw?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: Normalizing data: The what, why and how
value.excerpt: Normalizing data in Power BI: The what, why and how  When analyzing data by population, plotting the row data against the geographical location will fail to reveal important patterns when comparing countries with big differences in population and this is when it is useful to normalize the data. value.title: Running totals in power query??? Yes, you can :)
value.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you how you can do running totals or cummulative totals in Power Query, but do this only if you have no way to do it using DAX.  Also, I will show you how List.Range work, really cool function :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Schedule data downloads / exports in Power BI
value.excerpt: You can export data or download data out of Power BI in many different ways and depending on the source, you can schedule refresh those data dumps too.   In this video, I will give you one example on how to do that.  Other resources mentioned in this video: Export data with DAX Studio: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Gfgnk6R0Qw

value.title: Forecasting in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, we will learn how we can forecast our data in Power BI. We will be discussing which visualization supports forecasting in Power BI. We can perform forecasting with a Line chart in Power BI.  In this video, we have taken an example of a real-life scenario to forecast our data.  Stay Connected

value.title: Power BI Shows Incorrect Measure Total? How to fix it?
value.excerpt: During this session, we will try to resolve one of the most common issues that occur in Power BI Desktop which is Incorrect Measure Total issue for table or matrix visual. Sometimes, we have multiple tables in our report and we have prepared some DAX expression to calculate some values in our report.
